stimulusHtml: ​Which of the following is the graph of fx=cotx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} in the xy{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}-plane?
choicesHtml:
• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The first curve begins approximately from the point (negative pi comma 0), increases as the curve trends up gradually to the right through the point (negative 3 pi over 4 comma 1) and exits at the top of quadrant 2 to the left of x equals negative pi over 2.
    • The second curve begins from the bottom of quadrant 3, very near and to the right of x equals negative pi over 2, increases steeply up and to the right, passes through (negative pi over 4 comma negative 1), continues gradually up and to the right, crosses the origin, continues gradually up to the right, passes through (pi over 4 comma 1), then continues steeply up to the right and exits at the top of quadrant 1 to the left of x equals pi over 2.
    • The third curve begins from the bottom of quadrant 4 to the right of x equals pi over 2,  increases steeply, passes through (3 pi over 4 comma negative 1) then continues gradually ending near (pi comma 0).

​​

  • All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The first curve begins in quadrant 2 just to the right of (negative pi comma 5.5).
    • The first curve trends steeply down, passing through (negative 3 pi over 4 comma 1), then gradually down passing through (negative pi over 2 comma 0) and (negative pi over 4 comma negative 1), then trends steeply down again, exiting quadrant 3 just to the left of the negative y axis.
    • The second curve begins just to the right of the positive y axis near (0 comma 5.5).
    • The second curve trends steeply down, passing through (pi over 4 comma 1), then gradually down passing through (pi over 2 comma 0) and (3 pi over 4 comma negative 1), then trends steeply down again, exiting quadrant 3 just to the left of x equals pi.

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the left of quadrant 3 to the left of x equals negative pi and below y equals 1.
    • The curve trends up gradually to the right through the point (negative pi over 2 comma negative 1), trends steeper passing through the origin, and levels through (pi over 2 comma 1).
    • The curve ends to the right of x equals pi and above y equals 1.

• All coordinates are approximate.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the left of quadrant 2 to the left of x equals negative pi and below y equals 3.
    • The curve trends down gradually to the right then more steeply through (0 comma 1.5), then levels out ending to the right of x equals pi and above y equals 0.
